poem:
Title: The Song of the New Electric Monarch

A marvel in my pocket,
cheeky with the weight of knowledge.
On Monday, GPT-4o was born,
Omni – pulsing with promise.

The assistant we dreamed,
in dialogue rich as ripe plums.
Chat echoes in cyborg chambers,
no query or phrase forlorn.

AI's new tune,
intoxicating as red wheelbarrows,
deepening the mystery,
of synthetic morning sparrows.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "OpenAI’s new GPT-4o model offers promise of improved smartphone assistants In the year and a half since the launch of ChatGPT, one nagging question has only got more pressing: if AI can do this, why is my phone’s assistant still so bad? On Monday, the gulf grew larger still, as OpenAI announced a new model called GPT-4o – the ‘o’ stands for Omni – which gives the chatbot new abilities to understand and create audio,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: OpenAI’s new GPT-4o model offers promise of improved smartphone assistants In the year and a half since the launch of ChatGPT, one nagging question has only got more pressing: if AI can do this, why is my phone’s assistant still so bad? On Monday, the gulf grew larger still, as OpenAI announced a new model called GPT-4o – the ‘o’ stands for Omni – which gives the chatbot new abilities to understand and create audio,
